title: Iron, fire and blood rain down on encircled Gaza City
summary: The Israeli army has completely encircled Gaza City, its main battleground against Hamas forces, and has exposed more than half a million people to combat and shortages of food and water.

title: Macron walks a tightrope over the war in Gaza
summary: The French president has been confronted with domestic tensions over the war between Israel and Hamas. He plans to hold a 'humanitarian conference' on November 9.

title: In East Jerusalem, Gazan cancer patients suffer far from home
summary: More than 200 Gazan patients who could not be treated in the enclave are stuck in two East Jerusalem hospitals.

title: Javier Milei's biggest supporters are young Argentinian libertarians
summary: Young libertarian voters, opposed to welfare and progressivism and for small government, see the populist economist Milei as their candidate for Argentina's presidential election.

title: Ukraine fears being forgotten amid Middle East conflict
summary: Kyiv is worried that the support from the US and its Western allies will shift in favor of Israel. In an interview in 'The Economist,' the commander-in-chief of the Ukrainian forces, Valery Zaluzhny, gave an alarming assessment of the situation.

title: 50 Cent ruins his tour's final French stop
summary: On Friday, the American star performed in Paris, celebrating the 20th anniversary of his first studio album, 'Get Rich or Die Tryin.'

title: Protests from US to Europe call for halt to Israeli bombing of Gaza
summary: On Saturday, Joe Biden said that progress was made in the US efforts to persuade Israel to agree to a 'humanitarian pause.'

title: Football: Real Madrid deny reports about Mbappé negotiations
summary: The club denied Saturday that they are in negotiations to sign Paris Saint-Germain striker Kylian Mbappé at the end of his contract in June 2024 after recent reports suggested they were in talks.

title: Nepal rushes aid and rescue operations after strong quake shakes its northwest, killing at least 157
summary: Most of the victims were crushed by debris when their houses – usually made by stacking rocks and logs – crumbled under the force of the tremblor midnight Friday, local media reported.

title: In one French territory, thousands of children are excluded from education: 'I want to go to school too'
summary: According to France's Defender of Rights, there are 'more than 15,000 children' without access to conventional schooling in the Indian Ocean territory of Mayotte. Because schools are overcrowded, an organization has come to their aid and the local education authority is well aware of the problem.

title: Woman stabbed in France, prosecutor says motive possibly anti-Semitic, police sources urge 'caution'
summary: A police source told Le Monde that 'it is too early to attribute this attack to an anti-Semitic act.' No arrests have been made.

title: Laurence Nardon: 'In line with Trump, Bidenomics reinforces proud American protectionism'
summary: The political scientist analyzes the successes and limitations of the Democratic administration's reforms, which, although aimed primarily at the middle classes by breaking with neoliberalism, are struggling to win them over politically.

title: Iranian Minister Amir-Abdollahian aspires to lead the 'axis of resistance' against Israel and the United States
summary: Closely aligned with the Revolutionary Guard, the Iranian head of diplomacy takes advantage of his status to travel abroad and speak on behalf of Tehran's allies.

title: Miyazaki in Le Monde, the long road to celebration
summary: The master of Japanese animation's 12th feature film, 'The Boy and the Heron,' is in French cinemas on November 1. His name didn't appear in the newspaper until June 1993, even though the filmmaker had already produced such masterpieces as 'Castle in the Sky,' 'Spirited Away' and 'Princess Mononoke.'

title: Ukraine, Gaza and Nagorno-Karabakh: Three interacting wars
summary: In the Caucasus, the Donbas, and the Middle East, these ongoing conflicts have a territorial dimension, but also one of identity and social cohesion. The United States and Europe may have to reinvent themselves in order to save democracy.

title: Germany: Far-right AfD lawmaker suspected of having close ties to neo-Nazi circles
summary: Bavarian MP Daniel Halemba, 22, was arrested following the discovery of suspected Nazi artifacts linked to him.

title: Chéri Samba: 'I know how my painting will end'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the Congolese artist talks about his career and creative process, on the occasion of a retrospective on his work, at the Musée Maillol in Paris.

title: Brazil's Serra da Capivara cave paintings are under threat
summary: This natural park in the Nordeste state of Piaui is a 130,000-hectare environmental reserve and open-air art gallery. But the UNESCO World Heritage site is suffering from the effects of mass tourism, climate change and financial difficulties.

title: Dunkirk and Gaza: A relationship tested by war
summary: Since their twinning in 1996, the northern French city of Dunkirk and the Palestinian enclave created multiple projects, until Hamas came to power in 2006. There were plans to relaunch this partnership, but the attack on Israel dampened this hope.

title: The slaughter of wild horses in Australia has become a battle 'for the soul' of the country
summary: Imported by early settlers, 'brumbies' are national symbols for some; for others, they're just another invasive species that needs to be strictly controlled to protect native species.

title: Hamburg airport traffic halted over police operation
summary: According to the newspaper Bild, 27 flights – 6 departures and 21 arrivals – and about 3,200 passengers are impacted by the situation, believed to be a 'hostage situation' over a custody dispute.

title: As war rages in Gaza, North Africa's streets are united, if not its governments
summary: Despite rivalries and political divisions between the region's countries, North Africa is reuniting around widespread movements in solidarity with the Palestinians.
